The public health approach starts with needs assessment, 
which shows where and how we can improve local services to meet need and focus scarce resources. A series of needs assessments are carried out each year with the approval of the Health and Wellbeing Board. These are informed by the national evidence of what is known to work, and not work. The National Institute for Clinical and Health Excellence (Nice) regularly publishes guidance in an easily accessible form including information on cost-effective interventions by the NHS and local authorities, as well as interventions we should NOT be doing. Public health convenes a “Nice monitoring group” which reviews the guidance and its implementation within Croydon.

To request a reassessment for your wife's changed needs in Croydon, you should contact the Croydon Council's Adult Social Care team. Unfortunately, the available documents do not specify the exact process or timeline for how long a reassessment will take.

**Steps to Request a Reassessment:**
- **Contact Information:** Reach out to Croydon Council's Adult Social Care team. You can call them at **020 8726 6000**.
- **Provide Details:** Be prepared to explain how your wife's needs have changed since her last assessment.

**Additional Resources:**
- For more detailed guidance or assistance, you can visit the Croydon Council's website related to adult health and social care: [Croydon Adult Health and Social Care](https://www.croydon.gov.uk/adult-health-and-social-care/policies-and-complaints/local-account-adult-social-care-and-health-2023-2024).

If you need further assistance or have questions about the process, consider reaching out directly to the council for the most accurate and updated information.
